name: Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was an excellent hotel with a nice atmosphere and in a great location. As close to the beach as you can get, the ResortQuest Waikiki Beach is also in the middle of everything.. great restaurants, shopping, street entertainment on the weekends, and other great things. The hotel's restaurant, Tiki's Bar and Grill, is EXCELLENT! We absolutely loved everything we ordered--food, drinks, and appetizers, and the wait staff was very friendly.
reviews.title: would have been perfect if not for the construction

likes.disliked: — construction, woman at the front desk

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The woman at the front desk at check in was not helpful and unfriendly, but the other staff was very nice and accommodating.
reviews.title: Great location, good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The only other complaint was that while we were there, the hotel was under construction, which made it somewhat loud and at times inconvenient. However, we were aware of the construction beforehand and the plans for the renovated hotel looked beautiful.
reviews.title: Great Location in Waikiki

likes.disliked: — noisy ice machine, no microwave and coffe maker as promised by ResortQuest reservation line

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast buffet was excellent. There was a great variety that did not get old after an 8 night stay. The food was all great and you can take the food to go in convenient bags--either to the beach, to go on a tour, or back to your room. A great amenity especially for the great price of the room.
reviews.title: Perfect Location, great Breakfast!

likes.liked: — BOB (breakfast on beach), amazing views, proximity to everything including transportation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Great location just across the street from the heart of Waikiki Beach. Room was clean and comfortable. Complimentary breakfast is a bit over-rated, but it's free. Found a great rate, thanks to a tip we received from Travelzoo.com. Enjoyed our stay.
reviews.title: Great Room and Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon deciding that we wanted to get married in Hawaii we researched more hotels then you would ever believe. Everytime we started searching we ended up coming back to this one. While it may be a little more expensive then some others on the beach (but also less expensive then others) it was definitely worth it!
reviews.title: Absolutely wonderful...Very highly recommended!!!

likes.liked: — location, comfortable room, nice view, great breakfast
likes.disliked: — small lanais on diamond head side

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon entering our room we saw a bottle of champagne and 2 glasses congratulating us on our upcoming marriage, definitely a nice touch =)
reviews.title: Spring Break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: It was just the 2 of us, we had a king bed, and the room size was quite comfortable. And the bed was so soft and comfortable - great after a long day of walking and sight-seeing. Housekeeping was also great, every day we returned to our rooms they were clean and tidy...very nice to return to. We were on the 21st floor and had an awesome view (partial ocean). The only complaint I have is that the lanai/balcony on the diamond head side were quite small. The lanais around the other side and the front looked bigger, but we couldn't even fit a chair on ours! But all in all, I'd say that the rest of the experience with this hotel made up for that little problem.
reviews.title: Better than I expected! Would stay again!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The breakfast here is the best hotel breakfast I have ever seen....french toast sticks, cereal, asian, fresh fruit, scrambled eggs, etc. The breakfast alone saved us money on food!
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel!!!!! Would Recommend it to anyone :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel has everything...location, family friendly (we saw MANY families and children), awesome for couples, and just an all around a great service and atmosphere. I'd highly recommend this hotel to anyone and will definitely stay here upon returning to Honolulu.
reviews.title: Very good for families.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had a great rate of only $183 (inc. tax) a night for a Standard City View room. However, we were upgraded right away to a Partial Ocean View room because it was our 25th wedding anniversary. It was a beautiful room on the 22nd floor. The rooms had very nice clean and comfy bedding and a Great view. However,
reviews.title: Great Value! Amazed and Didn't Want to Leave

likes.liked: — breakfast, fun family/friendly environment, sufrboard theme carried throughout, location, daily/nightly entertainment, elevator security

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: the balcony was small and the room was small too. We came as a family of 4 and had 6 luggages...yea...No room! We could only open two suitcases at a time and still had trouble walking. But overall, it was very clean.
reviews.title: Good for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007
reviews.text: The elevators were very innovative as you HAD to put your room key in, in order to go to your room. The breakfast was a BARGAIN! There was a lot of options. However, the pool's hours were limited. I never could use it because we were busy throughout the day.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, but watch the extra charges

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel overall is very Hip and modern and fun! great...I will return next year!
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

likes.disliked: — Charge for wireless internet in rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our family stayed there from 8/1 to 8/6. The room is clean and beds comfortable. A bit small. We loved the breakfast buffet.
reviews.title: Great location shocking breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We took a shuttle from the airport and had driven through the not-so-nice areas of Honolulu and the parts of Waikiki Beach that were just shops and restaurants, but no beach. We hit a stretch of beach that was beautiful, and thought we had stopped in traffic, but a pleasant surprise was that we had arrived at our hotel, and we would be staying directly across the street from this great stretch of beach.
reviews.title: Great experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reception was very pleasant, the front desk gave us a warm and friendly reception, like they were truly glad to see us. They gave our child a welcome kit while we got the keys. It was nice to see all smiling faces after a long flight and a shuttle ride.
reviews.title: Honeymoon trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was nice, colorful. The layout reveals it has been around a good number of years, but there was no sign of neglect in the room--all paint, furniture, wallpaper and carpeting were very fresh. The entire property was well-maintained. We got upgraded to a room that also had a great view of Diamond Head as well as an ocean view.
reviews.title: Great Hotel! Great Value!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast on the Beach was a nice concept...since the food is all meant to be grab-and-go if needed, it can't be quite as tailored as if it were to be served and eaten right there. The fruits and fresh juices were great. The hot items were nice to have, and for free, I was happy with them, but again, are mass-produced for people to eat later on that day, if they choose, so expectations should be adjusted to take that into consideration. Even if you didn't walk to the beach, you can sit poolside with an excellent ocean view. What a great way to enjoy some breakfast and morning coffee!
reviews.title: A very nice, comfortable property!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location...great! The best beach on Waikiki. Even my friends who live in Honolulu were impressed with the location. Waikiki itself is really a lot of stores and chain restaurants, so having the park on the other side really was nice.
reviews.title: Loved the Breakfast on the Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were so grateful that we booked a hotel with a great view of the beach. We felt sorry for those folks treking a few blocks in, wrapped in their towels and lugging their sun screen. Our hotel had the feel of being in Hawaii. The staff was unbelieveably friendly and attentive. We loved breakfast with the music and the selection. This is not an expensive hotel, so providing the breakfast seemed very generous to us. Everything was clean. I can't say enough about what a wonderful stay we had here.
reviews.title: A perfect hotel
heaven is a place called hawaii
reviews.text: ALOHA its our 2nd time in the wonderful hawaii .we stayed at the coconut plaza the first time ,then the waikiki beach in march .the view from our room was lovely ,the rooms were so clean every day .

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the staff were very helpful to us i had to have a piece of hard board for the bed as i got a bad back and within 1/2 hour the managed to get a piece and brought it up to the room .
reviews.title: Great Price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: breakfast was lovely and u had had plenty to choose from
reviews.title: great hotel

likes.disliked: — the lifts were a pain but only because guests would break them by putting their credit cards into the slots and not their room keys like they were supposed to! yes the lifts do work if you use them properly!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: would stay here again hopefully in 2 yrs time
reviews.title: Fantastic location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We booked this 3 1/2 star hotel because it was decently priced, it included daily breakfast, and it looked like it was located close to the beach. We were not disappointed on any count.
reviews.title: location, location, location!

likes.liked: — the location and staff was very friendly

reviews.title: We have a good stay at Resort Quest
reviews.text: When we arrived at check-in, we were told that our room was being upgraded compiments of the hotel. Our room faced Diamond Head with a partial ocean view. It was spectacular! The room was clean, had nice bedding, and although there were two double beds (instead of queen/king as we are used to at home), the mattresses and bedding were so comfortable! We were given little insulated bags with which to take to breakfast--served buffet style near the pool. We could then take these to enjoy breakfast at the beach, in our room, or poolside, complete with live Hawaiian music and a hula dancer. It was a wonderful way to begin each day.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a great beach right across the street from the hotel. One area is walled in, giving a calmer atmosphere for people that just want to float or play in quieter waters. There is a walkway out into the water with a gazebo which turned out to be a popluar place for the teen locals to jump into the crashing waves. We were quite entertained by this. The beach area had great waves for boarding.
reviews.title: Honeymoon awesomeness

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel is next door to the zoo, which was a fun thing to do with the kids while my husband was off golfing. It is reasonably priced, too.
reviews.title: Location hides everything else

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: There are several places to eat right there at the hotel, including Tiki, located in the hotel, Wolfgang Puck Express, Coldstone, Subway, Starbucks, etc.
reviews.title: great service
Nothing To Write Home About
reviews.text: Getting late in writing my review. We stayed at this hotel in April for 3 nights. Booked off Hotel website. 2 nights/get 1 night FREE which includes breakfast. Paid around $500 for just the 2 nights. Really regret picking this hotel for what we got. We did get a balcony up on the 7th floor or so facing the beach. The room was nice with a large LCD TV, Fridge, Balcony, but the hotel seemed rather old with a poor makeover. It is rather noisy at night facing the main street. Our air conditioner didnt work the first night there but it was fixed in a hurry the next day. It's a good thing it wasn't too hot. Our bathroom towles had holes in them and when I took it to hotel manager, he apologized and gave us a $50 credit. The 3rd day we ran out of toilet paper and I had to call room service to bring us some.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: BREAKFAST...... OMG that really sucked. It was like jail food. (not that I've been there) but it was all wrapped up food to go and none of it was hot. This hotel claims to be a 3 star hotel but I would only rate it as a 2 star.....if that.
reviews.title: Would not recommend

likes.disliked: — No free internet service, rooms not very clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: I truly feel we were ripped off for what we got. The pool is small and there is nothing glamorous of the building or check in.
reviews.title: good outweighed bad

likes.disliked: — noisy at night (till 12.00 sometimes) the lifts!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We definately, will be staying away from ResortQuest.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel; couldn't have asked for more!

likes.liked: — The fantastic location and the view from the rooms!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I cannot say to many good things. We stayed from July 29 - August 1. The rooms were very small. We had 4 pieces of luggage and no where to store them. The balcony was so small that you could not sit a chair out there to enjoy the fresh air or the ocean. We had a partial ocean view room on the 20th floor. The shower curtain rod was rusty and my son hung his swimming trunks there and they were ruined by rust but the hotel did reimburse me $50 for them) because there is no where to hang your wet clothes. They said not to hang clothes from the balcony. The vent above the bathroom was filthy, there were paint chips on the walls and doors and the room was not very clean. We had to keep calling for towels. They knew there were 4 of us but only had 3 large towels. The beds were very small for 2 people. The elevators were slow. The front desk was not very helpful when asking them questions on how to get somewhere or were to go. They kept referring us to the Pleasant Holidays and they always wanted to book a tour for us and no I was not happy with them either. The breakfast was ok. I would not stay here again because it is to busy (populated) and did not like the rooms. We were spoiled from our hotel in Maui.
reviews.title: Great Location- ok hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We reserved our trip through Costco.com with the hopes that this would be a decent place to stay in Waikiki. On two previous visits, accomodations were mediocre and outdated. This however was a very nice hotel. The beds were very comfortable, breakfast was above the average, and most of the staff was very courteous and helpful.
reviews.title: Okay Place, beware of the valet service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our children spent one day in the kids camp, which we were very impressed with. Tiki's grill is okay, but I thought it was very overpriced for what you got. We had dinner one night on the beach at Duke's where the food was much better, service was outstanding, and the bill was much less than Tiki's. For anyone going to Waikiki I reccommend making a reservation at Duke's at least one night.
reviews.title: Loved the free breakfast/cooler to go

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Now for the downside of this hotel. The housekeeping forgot to clean our room one day, but when I called front desk they brought towels right away and it didn't happen again. I really thought it was very stingy not to provide wireless internet for free, the parking was awful, the valet's were rude, and I had my GPS stolen from my car because when you pull up they rush you so much that you don't have time to make sure you have everything, and all this for a whopping $20 a DAY!!!! I really don't appretiate the fact that the valet's take advantage of the "We are not responsible for lost or stolen items" clause on the claim ticket!! Resortquest, you need to run better background checks on your parking staff, and maybe teach them how to be a little more polite to the guests who are paying $20 a day to park there and then another $300 a day to sleep!
reviews.title: THE Best Hotel in Waikiki By a Long Shot

likes.liked: — Best location and view on Waikiki Beach, fantastic rooms and awesome breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Anyways, enough ranting...I would suggest this hotel to families and make sure to get a room on the upper floors on the Diamond Head side. I heard some of the guests complaining that the music from Tiki's will keep you up all night and into the morning on the pool side of the hotel. The elevators weren't as bad as in other reviews, for us anyways.
reviews.title: Give this resort a chance!!

likes.disliked: — Was all the way at the end of the beach, had to take a bus to get to the good stuff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would probably not stay here again, or anywhere in Waikiki for that matter. Last time we visited Oahu we stayed in a vacation rental in Kailua which was by far the best part of the whole island. Once you pay for the accomodations there is no extra charge for parking, most units have washers and dryers and meals are much more affordable since you have a kitchen to cook in or a BBQ to use. The beaches in Kailua are the best in Hawaii as well.
reviews.title: Great oceanfront hotel keeps getting better every year

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the ResortQuest Waikiki Beach Hotel at the end of June. On our arrival, everything went smooth and the staff was friendly and efficient. We went to our room and found that housekeeping was still cleaning the room so we went back to the front desk. A supervisor apologized for the inconvenience and said she was “upgrading” us to a better room. The new room had an ocean view which wasn’t bad but it was located right above Tiki’s bar and had 2 double beds instead of the king we had requested when we made our reservation. Since we were tired from our flight we thought we would give the room a try. Needless to say, the noise from Tiki’s and trying to sleep on a small bed was horrible and we got little sleep that night. The next day after returning from Pearl Harbor we went back to the front desk to see if we could change rooms. After watching the guy behind the counter play with his keyboard for 10 minutes he told us the only thing available would cost us an additional $60 a night! We told him we wouldn’t pay any more for another room and that we had requested a king bed and a room on a higher floor and his response was that rooms are not guaranteed. So after another 5 minutes of keyboard punching he said a room with a king bed would be available the next day which we said would be fine. Then he informed us that in order to change rooms we would have to check out the next morning and recheck in after 3pm! We thought that this was very unusual and questioned him to see if we heard him correct and was again told the same thing. Being quite irritated with this guy, we said okay and went to our room. After we got to our room, we decided that checking out and back in again was a disaster waiting to happen with this place. My wife called the front desk and spoke to a supervisor and explained the situation and was told that we did not have to check out and back in again and to just keep our belongings in the room until we were ready to switch rooms. The next day we hoped that the third times a charm, well lets just say that we did get a king bed with a just little less noise. We decided that since it was our anniversary we weren’t going to let the poor service ruin our trip.
reviews.title: Noisey, bad BOB
Very small, understaffed
reviews.text: The next disappointment was the breakfast on the beach or BOB for short. The selection of breakfast items was nothing like the brochures or website led you to believe. It had the basic continental breakfast items, coffee, juice, milk, cereal, pastries, yogurt, bagels (no cream cheese!), and fruit cups, along with some oriental items. Then there was this cold egg substance that was either rolled in a tortilla, on a bun, or in a plastic container with cold greasy tater tots that were really quite nasty and I almost forgot, the cold french toast sticks. Burger King across the street was an inexpensive breakfast if you were looking for breakfast that actually had meat.

reviews.title: Wonderful stay
reviews.text: The rooms are a bit on the small side. Even with just 2 people and luggage the room is cramped to move around in. The elevators seem to just do whatever. They go up when the arrow says going down and if you don’t get your card in the slot and floor selected quickly you get to go all the way to the top floor then back down to the lobby and then maybe back to your floor.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On an upside, what you see in the brochures and website is what you get as far as the décor of the hotel and the rooms go. The rooms were clean except for the very dusty vents and the king bed was comfortable for a hotel bed and with the exception of keyboard guy the staff was friendly and helpful. There was a Wolfgang Puck Express which had tasty pizza and sandwiches and a Subway and Coldstone at the hotel. The location across the street from the beach was a plus and a lot of the tour buses picked up at the hotel. The hotel was within walking distance of shopping or you could catch free shuttles to Hilo Hatties, Aloha Towers, or the Ala Moana shopping center. For a few dollars you can arrange a shuttle to the Aloha Stadium Flea Market which has great prices on souvenirs.
reviews.title: Perfect experience!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Overall, we were very disappointed with our choice of hotel. The good points just were not enough to outweigh the bad. My wife and I both work in businesses where customer service and solving problems quickly and efficiently are a must, so the treatment we received from the guy at the front desk left a really bad impression on us. Next year we’ll spend the little extra for one of the higher rated hotels.
reviews.title: Good Choice If Looking For Moderate Budget

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the ResortQuest Waikiki Beach from 3/6 to 3/14. I can't imagine a better hotel for the price that we paid! The staff was incredibly courteous & friendly, from the front desk clerks to the housekeeping staff.
reviews.title: A wonderful place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes, some of the rooms are small, but our room with 2 double beds was positively enormous! I really don't undertand all the complaints about the elevators - relax, you're in Hawaii! So what if it takes an extra 30 seconds to get to your room?
reviews.title: Clean gets my vote

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are very clean and comfortable, and having a flat-panel TV and a mini-fridge was icing on the cake!
reviews.title: Nice hotel.....if you don't expect too much.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Each morning, we would enjoy our complimentary "Breakfast on the Beach," served in the hotel's pool area - food was very good, and the entertainment (hula girl & singer) was lovely.
reviews.title: Tiny Rooms but Very Nice

likes.liked: — Location, directly across the street from Waikiki Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I cannot say enough nice things about the hotel's bar, Tiki's. Wonderful bartenders, excellent food and drinks. Try the kalua pig nachos!
reviews.title: Had a great time!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008
reviews.text: Before booking through AAA, I went on this website (tripadvisor) to look at the reviews. The reviews were extremely helpful to me in choosing whether this in fact would be the hotel that my family and I would decide to stay at.
reviews.title: I will stay there again if I go back to Oahu

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I liked this hotel for the following reasons:
reviews.title: Never Again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: FIVE STAR SERVICE -- we felt like family here -- my husband, who tended to go to the front desk for every little question, was greeted warmly each time. We felt like we were more than out of town paying guests but more like family! My gratitude to the staff for their extreme hospitality -- from the guy at the pool to the valets to the housekeeping and front desk staff -- we loved your hospitality and we would make this our temporary home again if we came back to Waikiki!
reviews.title: Great Place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: CLEANLINESS -- My accolades to the housekeeping staff -- the hotel was meticulously clean -- yes, some of you may say, well, shouldn't it be? I will tell you that we have stayed at five star hotels that was less than stellar!! I would also say the same for the service from previous five star hotels we've stayed.
reviews.title: Ahhh....you'll do!

likes.liked: — Meeting spot for most Tour pick-ups.
likes.disliked: — Unwillingness to clean a room, how I know the sheets werent reused?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: THE BREAKFAST ON THE BEACH -- The savings!! We liked the variety and the savings we were able to get just from being able to go downstairs for the complimentary breakfast EVERY DAY. I read some of the reviews here where few people said they were less than satisfied and I will say that it was more than sufficient for our family.
reviews.title: good breakfast, comfortable beds, not great location!!

likes.disliked: — loation on beach and noise from street and other rooms

reviews.title: Waikiki Beach Hotel Take 2
reviews.text: For my second trip to Hawaii I insisted on staying at the Waikiki Beach hotel again. This time I stayed in a "partial ocean view" room and on the 15th floor. Great view of the ocean but I had the alley way taking up half my view. I would say they should put some kind of overhang or cover over the alley because it not a pretty site. The hotel room was AMAZING just like the last time. Great beds, modern decor, and a large flat screen LCD TV.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast needs an overhaul. It's first come first serve basis so a half an hour before it was over there was nothing left to eat.
reviews.title: Room 1126 - noisy, but great view of Diamond Head

likes.liked: — great location on Waikiki Beach- walk to everything
likes.disliked: — noisy rooms, long waits for elevators

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The choices aren't the greatest. GREAT CONCEPT (free and pack your own) but so-so food. Staff was friendly, house keeping was flawless, and overall the stay was awesome. Always worth the price we pay. Ocean view at affordable price.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is our third trip to Waikiki, and our second time staying at this hotel. It's been redecorated and upgraded a bit since our last stay which is nice. Better beds, flat panel TVs, better carpeting, but the walls are still thin (this is an adjoining room so we heard our neighbor's phone calls, kids crying etc) and the lines for the elevators are still frustrating. Prior to getting into room 1126 we spent one very loud night in room 511 which is one floor above the pool and the bar. Unless you want to hear all the noise and watch all the pool action, including the breakfast crowd that starts to gather at 6:30am, don't accept any odd numbered rooms below the 9th floor.
reviews.title: Loved the Hotel!

likes.disliked: — Service was a bit lax, pool not always open

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The included breakfast was starch heavy and erratic. So much for serving breakfast until 9:30 - if you don't get down to the breakfast area by the pool (including Hawaiian singer and hula dancer) by 8:15 AM it's picked clean. Not good for those who don't eat dairy or have issues with gluten. Better - visit the bar at Tiki's in the hotel for a nightcap and your receipt will likely include a two for one breakfast offer for the full buffet at Tikis the next morning. $12.99 for two for a real breakfast is still good value.
reviews.title: A worthwhile place too stay

likes.liked: — It was situated close too the beach and close too all amenities

description: Overlooking one of the world's most renowned beaches, the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel provides an oceanfront experience at surprisingly accommodating rates. The Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel is the ideal vacation headquarters for couples, families (children stay free) and groups seeking the ultimate Hawaiian experience. The vast majority of our 644 guest rooms offer a private lanai and stunning full or partial ocean views. Diamond Head rises majestically on one side of the hotel, while legendary Waikiki Beach stretches out from the other.
